image.altText: Collage of a man in a polaroid frame with Vote No signage, Jacinta Nampijinpa Price and Warren Mundine

items.synopsis: The biggest known donor to the Advance Australia campaign group has backed a conspiracy theorist political candidate and holds a business interest in Indigenous land ventures.

title.children: Meet Simon Fenwick, the former Wall Street investor funding the No campaign

image.altText: Plumes of smoke rise from buildings in Gaza.

items.synopsis: Israeli air operations have struck residential buildings, including large tower blocks, as well as schools and UN buildings across Gaza, the UN says, as Israel warns Hamas that it has "nowhere to hide".

title.children: Schools and residences have been hit in air strikes on Gaza, UN says

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Iran's top authority Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said on Tuesday that Tehran had not been involved in Hamas' weekend attack on Israel, but he hailed what he called Israel's "irreparable" military and intelligence defeat. In his first televised speech since the attack, Khamenei said "we kiss the hands of those who planned the attack on the Zionist regime". "This destructive earthquake has destroyed some critical structures [in Israel] which will not be repaired easily … The Zionist regime's own actions are to blame for this disaster," said Khamenei. Iran has long backed the Hamas group, which controls the Gaza Strip and rejects Israel's right to exist. Reuters
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Iran's Supreme Leader speaks out on Hamas attack

children.content: Iran's top authority Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said on Tuesday that Tehran had not been involved in Hamas' weekend attack on Israel, but he hailed what he called Israel's "irreparable" military and intelligence defeat.
In his first televised speech since the attack, Khamenei said "we kiss the hands of those who planned the attack on the Zionist regime".
"This destructive earthquake has destroyed some critical structures [in Israel] which will not be repaired easily … The Zionist regime's own actions are to blame for this disaster," said Khamenei.
Iran has long backed the Hamas group, which controls the Gaza Strip and rejects Israel's right to exist.

props.alt: An image of Ayatollah Ali Khamenei

children.content: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei speaks during a meeting earlier this month.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Israeli air operations have struck residential buildings, including large tower blocks, as well as schools and UN buildings across Gaza, resulting in civilian casualties, the United Nations Human Rights chief has said. Citing information gathered by his office, Volker Turk said in a statement: "International humanitarian law is clear: the obligation to take constant care to spare the civilian population and civilian objects remains applicable throughout the attacks." In response to Israeli Defence Minister Yoav Gallant's announcement of a tightened blockade for the Gaza strip, Mr Turk said that "sieges" that endanger the lives of civilians are prohibited under international law. The United Nations agency for Palestinian refugees said it was struggling to accommodate more than 187,518 Palestinians in Gaza displaced by ongoing Israeli strikes, as hospitals and schools that it runs across the Gaza Strip were damaged in the fighting. Reuters/AP
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Israeli air strikes hit residences, schools across Gaza: United Nations

children.content: Israeli air operations have struck residential buildings, including large tower blocks, as well as schools and UN buildings across Gaza, resulting in civilian casualties, the United Nations Human Rights chief has said.
Citing information gathered by his office, Volker Turk said in a statement:
"International humanitarian law is clear: the obligation to take constant care to spare the civilian population and civilian objects remains applicable throughout the attacks."

In response to Israeli Defence Minister Yoav Gallant's announcement of a tightened blockade for the Gaza strip, Mr Turk said that "sieges" that endanger the lives of civilians are prohibited under international law.
The United Nations agency for Palestinian refugees said
it was struggling to accommodate more than 187,518 Palestinians in Gaza displaced by ongoing Israeli strikes, as hospitals and schools that it runs across the Gaza Strip were damaged in the fighting.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The Israeli military said on Tuesday that Hamas operatives had "nowhere to hide in Gaza" and that the air force was carrying out unprecedently intensive air strikes in the Palestinian enclave in waves every four hours. "We will reach them (Hamas) everywhere," chief military spokesperson Rear-Admiral Daniel Hagari said in a briefing. Reuters
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Israeli military says Hamas 'has nowhere to hide' in Gaza

children.content: The Israeli military said on Tuesday that Hamas operatives had "nowhere to hide in Gaza" and that the air force was carrying out unprecedently intensive air strikes in the Palestinian enclave in waves every four hours.
"We will reach them (Hamas) everywhere," chief military spokesperson Rear-Admiral Daniel Hagari said in a briefing.

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

items.synopsis: The trial of Canberra man accused of molesting two sisters ran for two weeks, but after a day and a half of deliberations the jury was discharged after failing to reach a verdict.

image.altText: A grey-haired man wears a transparent eyepatch on his left eye.

items.synopsis: Shannon Davis was declared legally blind due to end-stage glaucoma at 43, despite reporting no symptoms beforehand. He's now calling for more awareness of and testing for the disease, which is known as "the silent thief of sight".
